channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet

item.title: The open space in gascoyne drive and wyatr road are being plagued wirh gas canisters and also borh bits of land arein costant use by fly tippers,disgraceful., 15th February
item.description:
Complete waste of space, land is a dumping ground for rubbish.

item.title: Parking bay markings very faint., 15th February
item.description:
On Glebe Road, the even side of the road, the parking bay lines are very faint. Some we can hardly see where it starts or ends. Please could you sent a team to repaint them?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Glebe Road, Plaistow, Greater London

item.title: Footpath, 15th February
item.description:
The shortcut between College Slip and Sainsbury's car park is used by many people and is now dangerous because the boards laid over the soil are smashed or decayed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): College Slip, Plaistow, Greater London

item.title: Potholes within Morrisons car park, 15th February
item.description:
There are a number of pot holes in the Morrisons car park which could cause substantial harm to someone’s car. They are very visible and large especially coming up to the exit of the car park
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Springfield Road, Welling, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Extensive deep potholes over 30 meters., 15th February
item.description:
Extensive, deep, hazardous potholes on Old Farm Avenue outside 361-365. The section is 1m wide by 30m long and contains several potholes that exceed the emergency repair intervention criteria. The defects are particularly hazardous to vulnerable road users. This section of highway has been in a poor condition for many years.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 328, Old Farm Avenue, Longlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Raise crossing higher than 10cm as set by the uk Highway legislation, 15th February
item.description:
This hump is higher than 10cm and cars are catching underneath as you can see scratch mark on the hump and making bus journeys uncomfortable. Previously reported two months ago and still nothings been done except parallel crossing signs being up.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 56, Newington Green, Highbury, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
